intro: Gentiana atroviolacea, commonly known as the black violet gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its striking deep violet to almost black flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and slightly hairy. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas. The flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
